page.title: 01North East of Oldeldrum
page.content: General impression is a patchwork of considerably sheltered undulating arable farmland. Overhead electric and telephone lines and old drystone dykes create a familiar network over the landscape. Established deciduous woodland attracts a few roe deer. Springtime brings glorious yellow splashes of gorse and broom. Barley is the main crop. Wheat,turnips, potatoes, oats and oilseed rape are also grown. livestock is mainly beef cattle. At Parkside a Multiplication Pig Breeding Unit also houses a computer information bureau for farmers. At chapelcroft a commercial egg producing farm of 64000 hens yield 32000 dozen eggs weekly. Meldrum House Hotel offers quiet seclusion to visitors. Thousands of young trees have been planted at Tulloch and Kilblean,
